net.beadsproject.beads.data.audiofile

Interface AudioFileReader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WavFileReaderWriter

    public interface AudioFileReader
    Implementing this interface indicates support for 'one-shot' reading of an audio file. That is, an entire audio file can be opened, read into a float[][] and then closed in a single blocking method.
    Author:
    aengus

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SampleAudioFormat getSampleAudioFormat()
      After reading, the SampleAudioFormat can be obtained.

      float[][] readAudioFile(java.lang.String filename)

    • Method Detail

      • readAudioFile

        float[][] readAudioFile(java.lang.String filename)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        OperationUnsupportedException,
                        FileFormatException
        Single method to read an entire audio file in one go.
        Parameters:
        data - - upon return, this will point to a 2D array containing all the audio data. The first dimension (data.length) is the number of channels. The second dimension (data[0].length) is the number of frames.
        filename - - the name of the file to be read
        saf - - upon return, this will point to a SampleAudioFormat object containing the details of the sample data that was read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        OperationUnsupportedException
        FileFormatException

      • getSampleAudioFormat

        SampleAudioFormat getSampleAudioFormat()
        After reading, the SampleAudioFormat can be obtained.
        Returns:
        the SampleAudioFormat object describing the sample data that has been read in.

      • getSupportedFileTypesForReading

        java.util.HashSet<AudioFileType> getSupportedFileTypesForReading()
        Get the supported file types.
        Returns:
        - the supported file types.
